decks.notes: The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by utilizing cards like Magus of the Moon, Blood Moon, and Chalice of the Void to disrupt their mana base and prevent them from casting spells effectively. Additionally, by using aggressive creatures like Fury and Pyrogoyf, the deck aims to deal quick damage to the opponent and close out the game before they can recover. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Sundering Eruption to deal with any threats the opponent may have on the board.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, and Murktide Regent, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Wasteland, Force of Will, and Daze. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game and force the opponent to react to its threats, ultimately leading to a quick victory through aggressive plays and resource denial. The deck's mana base allows for consistent casting of spells while also enabling the use of powerful cards like Lightning Bolt and Brazen Borrower.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bring them back into play using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo, as well as card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the combo pieces. The creatures in the deck are high-impact threats like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent, supported by planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. This deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with its powerful reanimated creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive Eldrazi creatures, supported by powerful disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Kozilek's Command. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher while using mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck also utilizes land disruption with Wasteland and fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck is focused on assembling a specific combo that allows the player to win the game quickly and efficiently by emptying their library and using Thassa's Oracle to win on the spot. The deck includes various ways to generate mana quickly, protect the combo with Pact of Negation, and disrupt opponents with hand disruption and removal spells. The goal is to quickly and aggressively execute the combo while preventing opponents from interfering, resulting in a swift victory.

This deck focuses on developing a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic, Recruiter of the Guard, and Skyclave Apparition while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and mana denial with Wasteland and Karakas. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value through blinking creatures like Flickerwisp and generating card advantage. Throughout the game, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and control the board to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using cards like Show and Tell, Omniscience, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to cheat out powerful creatures and spells without paying their mana costs. Using counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Stock Up provide additional utility and ways to dig for combo pieces. The goal is to establish a dominant board state and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells and hand disruption spells. It also utilizes efficient removal spells to deal with threats and tempo plays to slow down the opponent. The creatures in the deck provide additional pressure and card advantage, while the mana base is designed to provide consistent access to both blue and black mana sources. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure to win the game quickly.

The main strategy of the deck is to quickly get out big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier by casting Show and Tell or cheating them into play with Omniscience. The deck features a lot of card filtering and protection with cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Daze. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan with counterspells and denial effects. The deck also includes a mana acceleration package with Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to help cast expensive spells early.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cast a series of spells to mill through your entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Laboratory Maniac. The deck uses cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate mana production, while also utilizing cards like Pact of Negation to protect the combo. Agadeem's Awakening and Dread Return are used for graveyard recursion, while creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer are used to mill through your deck rapidly. Overall, this deck aims to win the game as fast as possible through its powerful combo potential.

The main concept of this deck is to use the card Doomsday to set up a winning combination of cards in the library, followed by using Thassa's Oracle or Murktide Regent to win the game. The deck focuses on efficient filtering and card draw to find the key pieces quickly, while also including disruption and protection elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student adds additional card advantage and flexibility to the deck's strategy. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a compact and powerful manner.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats and applying pressure. Utilizing cheap disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, along with removal spells like Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game. Cards like Daze and Brazen Borrower are used to further disrupt the opponent's plays, while creatures like Nethergoyf and Orcish Bowmasters provide a clock to close out the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support the tempo strategy with efficient fetch lands and Wastelands.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp. This allows for cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return to be easily activated, creating a powerful combo where multiple creatures can be put onto the battlefield. Cabal Therapy is used to disrupt opponents' strategies while cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Otherworldly Gaze provide additional fuel for the graveyard. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a board presence that is difficult to deal with.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Gaea's Cradle and mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise. It also utilizes toolbox creatures like Wight of the Reliquary and Endurance to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck is capable of quickly ramping into powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth or Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also having the flexibility to tutor for specific answers with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order. The key concept of this deck is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through efficient mana ramp and versatile creature toolbox options.

This deck focuses on using Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and disrupt opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures with Enter the Battlefield effects like Skyclave Apparition and Baleful Strix to control the board and generate value. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional versatility and card advantage in longer games. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early with aggressive creatures while maintaining control through disruption and card advantage.

The deck revolves around using the card "Show and Tell" to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play for free. By using cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Stock Up to dig through the deck, players aim to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to put their big threats into play. Cards like Force of Will and Daze help protect the combo while cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb allow for faster mana generation to get the combo online as quickly as possible.
